name: Ability Checks
summary: Roll a d20 plus ability modifier to determine success on tasks.
text: An ability check tests a character's or monster's innate talent and training in an effort to overcome a challenge. To make an ability check, roll a d20 and add the relevant ability modifier and proficiency bonus if applicable.

name: Saving Throws
summary: Defensive checks made to resist spells, traps, poison, and other hazards.
text: A saving throw represents an effort to resist a spell, a trap, a poison, a disease, or a similar threat. To make a saving throw, roll a d20 and add the relevant ability modifier. A saving throw can also include a proficiency bonus if a creature has proficiency in that type of save.

name: Advantage and Disadvantage
summary: Roll two d20s and use the higher or lower result depending on circumstances.
text: Sometimes a special ability or spell tells you that you have advantage or disadvantage on an ability check, a saving throw, or an attack roll. When that happens, you roll a second d20. Use the higher roll if you have advantage, and use the lower roll if you have disadvantage.
